dublin_core.dcvalue: Karin Kallander, Program Coordinator, Malaria Consortium, Email: k.kallander@malariaconsortium.org | Paulin Basinga, Senior Program Officer, Gates Foundation, Email: paulin.basinga@gatesfoundation.org

inScale uses images and audio to train CHWs on consultation steps to assess, classify, treat and refer patients. The decision support tool includes a checklist of mild and severe signs of diarrhea, pneumonia and malaria and provides treatment guidance. The application also collects weekly case data and drug stock levels that are sent to a central server.
Made available in DSpace on 2020-10-14T10:20:14Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 1 inscale.pdf: 210004 bytes, checksum: d25778921159bea83871ccf62f64865f (MD5)
Innovation At Scale For Community Access And Lasting Effects (inSCALE)
Electronic Decision Support, Sensors and point-of-care diagnostics, Electronic Health Records, Child Health
